image.altText: Aerial view of bushfire in wilderness area.

props.synopsis: Thousands of dry lightning strikes have sparked multiple bushfires, some within remote national parks and wilderness areas, on Tasmania's west coast.

title.children: Dry lightning strikes spark bushfires in Tasmanian wilderness areas

image.altText: Three people smiling for photo on a removalist truck

props.synopsis: When this Hobart hotel was doing its refurbishment, it knew it didn't want all the old furniture to end up in landfill. Now, it's helping create a cosy home for women at risk of homelessness.

title.children: 'Rather than going to landfill': Hotel's big donation goes to refuge

image.altText: A person with long dark hair works on a computer with software code on two screens.

props.synopsis: With job availability in sectors such as healthcare and tech predicted to rise over the next 15 years, there is concern that some students are receiving outdated career guidance.

title.children: Fears Australia's kids aren't ready for jobs like automation engineer

image.altText: Artist impression of launch tower for zip-line proposal.

props.synopsis: It would give riders a "100k/ph thrill" lasting "one minute and 20 seconds" — but opponents to a zip-line plan for Hobart's mountain say they are "sick" of having to "defend" the area from private developers.

title.children: Aboriginal group blasts zip-line plan for 'sacred place'

image.altText: woman smiles slightly at camera

props.synopsis: International students are reporting a range of negative experiences, including overt racism and bias against them in the classroom. The Australian Human Rights Commission is preparing its final report on the prevalence and impact of racism in the country's universities.

title.children: International students report facing racism, bias regarding academic proficiency

image.altText: A woman in a pony tail and white top sits on a pink couch with shelves packed with books and trinkets behind her.

props.synopsis: Lorraine Jordan was an "approved occupant" of a social housing property in Tasmania, but when her son moved out her provider issued a trespass notice and changed the locks, locking her cat inside. Her legal win has given more rights to 4,300 people — but the government has appealed.

title.children: Tenancy rights tested as social housing provider changes locks with cat inside

image.altText: Icy poles and ice in a children's shell outdoor pool.

props.synopsis: With room temperatures reportedly reaching around 30 degrees inside the Launceston General Hospital, staff and patients have been given frozen treats to help them cope because of inadequate air-conditioning.

title.children: Ice treats given to patients, staff as hospital grapples with aircon fix

image.altText: Jim Chalmers speaks in the parliament

props.synopsis: It was starting to get potty in the House of Representatives even before Question Time turned the rhetoric up to 11. Enter Jim Chalmers, a treasurer eager to fill voids in Coalition policies.

title.children: A backbencher stood up, prepared with a zinger. Question Time escalated from there

image.altText: Journalist Antoinette Lattouf, centre, arrives at the Federal Court of Australia with two male lawyers either side of her

props.synopsis: Freelance journalist Antoinette Lattouf recalled being given a suggestion to "keep a low profile" on social media but said she was not directed to avoid posting on social media altogether.

title.children: Antoinette Lattouf tells court she wasn't directed to avoid social media

image.altText: Troy Selwood of the Lions runs with the ball

props.synopsis: Former Brisbane Lions player Troy Selwood, brother of Geelong premiership captain Joel, has died aged 40.

title.children: Family 'heartbroken' by sudden death of former AFL player Troy Selwood

image.altText: The flags of the US, Canada and Mexico side by side

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump says he will pause tariffs on Canada and Mexico for a month, but levies on China are still set to take effect on February 4.

title.children: Trump paused tariffs on Canada and Mexico. So what was agreed with the US?

image.altText: Elon Musk standing behind a podium, raising his fists in the air and shouting.

props.synopsis: The Tesla and SpaceX owner is now considered a "special government employee" as he works to shrink the US government, potentially bypassing conflict of interest and financial disclosure laws.

title.children: Musk made 'special government employee' as USAID closed down

image.altText: An explosion at a factory fire.

props.synopsis: Two firefighters are treated for heat exhaustion and nearby residents are evacuated after a fire broke out at a factory in St Marys, near Penrith.

title.children: Over 150 firefighters battle large blaze at Western Sydney factory

image.altText: A bus outside a damaged home.

props.synopsis: A woman says it is lucky her family was not home when a passenger bus ploughed into her house in Sydney's south-west this morning, causing extensive damage.

title.children: Bus with passengers crashes into south-west Sydney home

image.altText: Samantha Kerr walks past an ABC journalist who is holding a microphone in front of her

props.synopsis: The body-cam vision of alleged victim, PC Stephen Lovell, was played to the court on the opening day of the trial in London.

title.children: Moment Sam Kerr allegedly racially harassed police officer played to court

image.altText: Crowd of people wearing hi vis stand outside a building in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: Led by CFMEU administrator Mark Irving KC, the inquiry will work with construction union staff and stakeholders to stamp out conduct he described as "unacceptable in any workplace".

title.children: Inquiry to probe claims of violence in Queensland's construction industry

image.altText: Jo Haylen NSW Minister for Transport at a press conference

props.synopsis: Despite surviving numerous political scandals, outgoing transport minister Jo Haylen was brought undone by her own personal use of taxpayer-funded transport.

title.children: The scandals Jo Haylen survived before coming undone by a 'long lunch'

image.altText: Mary Fowler warming up before a match, looking at the crowd

props.synopsis: A rejuvenated and in-form Mary Fowler has been named to return to the Matildas set-up after opting to withdraw from the side's most recent international window.

title.children: Still only 21 years old, Mary Fowler is the old favourite back for the Matildas

image.altText: A specialist checks the skin of a patient.

props.synopsis: When specialist referrals expire, some patients are being charged twice for more costly initial consultations, despite their care being ongoing. Health experts say it's a potentially illegal practice that's costing patients.

title.children: Repeat referrals are costing Medicare and patients

image.altText: Dale Tapping at a press conference, standing and looking at reporters

props.synopsis: Dale Tapping was diagnosed with the aggressive form of blood cancer in January 2023 and died on Tuesday at the age of 59, the club said.

title.children: AFL world mourns after death of Bombers and Lions assistant coach

image.altText: A man and a woman wearing a 'DISRUPT BURRUP HUP' T-shirt are led by police officers

props.synopsis: Four climate activists arrested outside the Perth home of Woodside boss Meg O'Neill had planned to damage her fence and garage door with paint as part of a "publicity stunt", the Perth Magistrates Court hears.

title.children: 'I'm not sorry': Activist who targeted Woodside CEO's home defiant

image.altText: Lawrence has police officers on both sides. He has his head down as he is moved into a police van from court room.

props.synopsis: A 45-year-old Victorian man who allegedly ploughed through a regional shopping centre in the middle of the after-school rush has been charged with a slew of driving offences.

title.children: Man accused of driving car through shopping centre faces court

image.altText: A harvester in a field.

props.synopsis: There are fears US tariffs could lead to increased competition in key markets for Australian commodities and dampen demand in our biggest markets.

title.children: What would an era of protectionism mean for Australia?

image.altText: A slate-coloured sign bearing a coat of arms and the words "Kununurra Courthouse".

props.synopsis: A 40-year-old Kununurra man accused of seriously injuring a woman with his vehicle before fleeing the scene has been granted bail.

title.children: Pedestrian still in intensive care as hit-and-run accused faces court

image.altText: A smiling man wearing a suit embraces a woman wearing a football uniform

props.synopsis: The kiss following Spain's Women's World Cup win became a reckoning for Spanish soccer, with several of the sport's former top male officials on trial in Madrid.

title.children: My boss shouldn't have kissed me, Jenni Hermoso tells sexual assault trial

image.altText: A still of Blake Lively and Justin Baldoni

props.synopsis: A federal judge has warned the lawyers of Blake lively to tone down media battle between the former It Ends with Us co-stars.

title.children: Judge scolds Lively and Baldoni lawyers for public comments ahead of trial

image.altText: A young man with a sunburned face except around his eyes, where his sunglasses were.

props.synopsis: If you think the Australian summer sun feels harsher than a summer in the Northern Hemisphere, you're not wrong. But why that's the case may surprise you.

title.children: Australia's UV levels are high, but the ozone hole isn't the culprit

image.altText: Australia batter Travis Head hits the ball away during a Test against Sri Lanka.

props.synopsis: Travis Head played another blistering knock at the top of the order in the first Test against Sri Lanka, but doubts he'll ever face the new ball in Australia.

title.children: Head not harbouring long-term opening plans, flags Konstas return

image.altText: A man with a blonde beard wearing a blue stripy polo shirt and a baseball cap

props.synopsis: A defence lawyer has told a court that the evidence of a key witness in a criminal neglect trial against father Ashley McGregor was "simply unbelievable".

title.children: Key witness in criminal neglect trial against SA father 'simply unbelievable', court hears

image.altText: Lawrence has police officers on both sides. He has his head down as he is moved into a police van from court room.

props.synopsis: A 45-year-old Victorian man who allegedly ploughed through a regional shopping centre in the middle of the after-school rush has been charged with a slew of driving offences.

title.children: Man accused of driving car through shopping centre faces court

image.altText: Aerial photo of end of island with aqua ocean rocky edge

props.synopsis: South Australia's fourth-largest island is set to become an ark for mammal species recovery, funded by $4.8 million from governments including ridding the island of rats, mice, and cats.

title.children: $4.8 million pledged to return island to the wild to save threatened species

image.altText: Police tape cordons off a street with police vans parked on either side of the road and an officer walking across the street.

props.synopsis: A man is in custody after a 72-year-old man died and a woman was seriously injured in what police say was a family violence incident in the Perth suburb of Clarkson.

title.children: Man dies, woman seriously injured in suspected family violence incident in Perth

image.altText: Three boys in school uniform walk through the gates of a school building with a sign reading "St Edmund's College Canberra".

props.synopsis: Prosecutors argue former Canberra student teacher Petra Shasha should face jail time for the persistent sexual abuse of a 15-year-old boy, who she met working as a trainee teacher at St Edmund's College.

title.children: Former student teacher should be jailed for child sex abuse, court hears
